videoDescription:

Full Docker Tutorial | Complete Docker Course | Hands-on course with a lot of demos and explaining the concepts behind, so that you really understand it.

#docker #dockertutorial #techworldwithnana

By the end, you will have a deep understanding of the concepts and a great overall big picture of how Docker is used in the whole software development process. 
The course is a mix of animated theoretic explanation and hands-on demo’s to follow along, so you get your first hands-on experience with Docker and feel more confident using it in your project.

videoTitle: Docker Tutorial for Beginners - A Full DevOps Course on How to Run Applications in Containers
videoDescription:
Get started using Docker with this end-to-end beginners course with hands-on labs.

Docker is an open platform for developers and sysadmins to build, ship, and run distributed applications, whether on laptops, data center VMs, or the cloud.

In this course you will learn Docker through a series of lectures that use animation, illustration and some fun analogies that simply complex concepts, we have demos that will show how to install and get started with Docker and most importantly we have hands-on labs that you can access right in your browser. 

💻 Practice Labs: https://bit.ly/3IxaqRN

🔗 KodeKloud Website: https://www.kodekloud.com

videoTitle: What is DevOps? - In Simple English
videoDescription:
Simple explanation of DevOps without the complications and information overload.  -- what do you think? Please share & comment! 

DevOps is a concept with different interpretations and definitions, but when you get down to it, it's all about developers and operations teams breaking down silos and working together to innovate faster. For many companies, the ability to innovate at a rapid pace — responding to market conditions and customer feedback — is a key factor for success. Adopting the DevOps philosophy requires a new mindset, new tools and new skills.

videoTitle: DevOps Engineering Course for Beginners
videoDescription:
What is DevOps in the context of software engineering? Learn all about DevOps in this comprehensive course for beginners with three technical tutorials. You will learn what DevOps is, continuous integration, continuous deployment strategies, and application performance management. Many DevOps practices are commonly used in programming and web development, it is important to understand key terms and technologies. 

This course often references the MERN (MongoDB, Express JS, React JS, Node JS) technology stack. You will get a series of talks with technology recommendations based on these best practices. There will be several programming examples embedded in these talks. As long as you know the absolute basics of coding and the web, you'll have no problem following along. 

⭐️ Course Notes ⭐️
🔗 Lesson 1: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-devops/
🔗 Lesson 2: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-test-driven-development/

🔗 Lesson 5: https://layerci.com/blog/linting-best-practices/
🔗 Lesson 6: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-an-ephemeral-environment/

🔗 Lesson 12: https://layerci.com/blog/what-is-log-aggregation/
🔗 Lesson 13: https://layerci.com/blog/vital-production-metrics/

videoTitle: What's the Difference Between DevOps and SRE? (class SRE implements DevOps)
videoDescription:
Seth Vargo and Liz Fong-Jones go head-to-head to determine which is better: DevOps or Site Reliability Engineering (SRE). In this video, Liz and Seth discuss the differences and similarities between DevOps and SRE, ultimately realizing that DevOps and SRE aren't two competing methods, but rather close friends designed help break down organizational barriers to deliver better software faster. DevOps is like an abstract class in programming, and SRE is one possible implementation of that class.

videoTitle: ChatGPT Tutorial - Use ChatGPT for DevOps tasks to 10x Your Productivity
videoDescription:
ChatGPT Tutorial for DevOps - What is ChatGPT? How to use ChatGPT? My opinion on whether ChatGPT will replace engineers
💛  Follow me on LinkedIn and IG for weekly updates   ►  https://bit.ly/2F3LXYJ
💙  Become a DevOps Engineer - 6-month program       ►  https://bit.ly/43nK7ra
💚  Mini-Bootcamp for IT Beginners                                  ►  https://bit.ly/3BRz6To

#chatgpt   #techworldwithnana 

►  This video is sponsored by Firefly 🙌🏼
►  For more infos: https://eu1.hubs.ly/H02z-Lf0
►  Open source tool AIaC: https://eu1.hubs.ly/H02z-GD0

I'm sure you have all heard of ChatGPT by now. It has become a buzzword within days of its release and professionals in all fields, especially in high skilled areas like lawyers, doctors, engineers are questioning whether such AI can actually replace them and work.

So in this video I want to talk about what ChatGPT is and how it even popped up, talk a bit about the organization behind GPT called "OpenAI", which has already created many other machine learning models besides Chat GPT and also explain technically about all that.
And then we'll dive in and actually put ChatGPT to use for some DevOps related tasks.
I really want to see how it can help in generating configuration code for building DevOps processes or different parts of those processes and how well it knows different DevOps technologies, but not just some shallow examples or boilerplate code that I can get from official documentation, but instead also try more fine-tuning and small optimizations in that configuration code.

We're also going to check out an open source command line tool that is built on top of ChatGPT and was specifically created for engineers to generate infrastructure as code templates and more and finally we'll talk about the impact of ChatGPT, the quality and usefulness of such a tool for engineers and whether it will really replace the engineers and to what extent you should be concerned.

#edureka #DevOpsEdureka #DevOps #DevOpsTools #DevOpsTraining #DevOpsTutorial #DevOpsJenkins

About the Course
Edureka’s DevOps online training is designed to help you master key tools of Devops lifecycle like Docker, Puppet, Jenkins, Nagios, GIT, Ansible, SaltStack and Chef used by a DevOps Engineer for automating multiple steps in SDLC. During this course, our expert DevOps instructors will help you:

1. Understand the concepts and necessities of DevOps
2. Understand the need for DevOps and the day-to-day real-life problems it resolves
3. Learn installation and configuration of common infrastructure servers like Apache, and Nginx for the Enterprise
4. Learn popular DevOps tools like Jenkins, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, SaltStack, Nagios and GIT
5. Implement automated system update, installations and deployments 
6. Learn Virtualization Concepts 
7. Configuration deployment and packaging, continuous integration using GIT
8. Fine tune Performance and set-up basic Security for Infrastructure 
9. Manage server operations using Code which is popularly known as Infrastructure as a Code
10. Understand the need for and concepts of Monitoring and Logging. 

Along with the above mentioned topics, to help you master the most popular DevOps tools, you will also receive 3 additional self-paced courses including presentations, class recordings, assignments, solutions for the following tools:

1: Ansible - Covers Introduction, Setup & Configuration, Ansible Playbooks, 37 Ansible Modules, Different Roles and Command Line usage. 2: Chef - Covers Introduction, Building the Cook Book, Node Object & Search, Data-bags, Chef environment, Roles, Deploying Nodes in Production and using the Open Source Chef Server.

3: Puppet - Covers Puppet Infrastructure & run-cycle, the Puppet Language, Environment defining Nodes and Modules, Provisioning a Web Server and Executing Modules Against A Puppet Master.

Who should go for this course?
DevOps practitioners are among the highest paid IT professionals today, and the market demand for them is growing rapidly. With emergence of new job roles around DevOps philosophy, anyone aspiring to get into these new roles, can take up this DevOps course. Some of these roles are:

1. DevOps Architect
2. Automation Engineer
3. Software Tester
4. Security Engineer
5. Integration Specialist
6. Release Manager

Project Work
1. Host a dummy webpage using Apache Web Server.
2. Write shell script which reports:
a) Various system configurations related to the user and the OS.
b) Data related to load on the server.
c) Top 5 processes with maximum number of threads.
d) Sort the services by memory
3. Install Nagios on a VM node for monitoring the various parameter of the VM.

videoTitle: What is DevOps? - DevOps explanation by WebGentle | Explained Dev
videoDescription:
What is DevOps? This DevOps is the most famous word in the IT industry nowadays. People want to become DevOps engineers but they don't know where to start. Most people think that DevOps is a programming language or technology that they can learn and become a DevOps engineer. But DevOps does not work in such a way.

DevOps is a mindset, a way of working for an organization so that new features reach the users as quickly as possible. 
This video has a simple explanation of DevOps. if you want to be a DevOps engineer then it will be your first question. Azure tutorial | Azure DevOps Tutorial will help you to become an azure DevOps engineer.

videoTitle: Cloud Engineer vs DevOps Engineer - Differences and Overlaps of tasks and responsibilities
videoDescription:
Differences and Overlaps of Cloud and DevOps Engineer Roles as well as deep dive of Cloud Engineer Tasks and Responsibilities

DevOps engineer and Cloud engineer are 2 popular roles in software engineering. But there is a lot of mix up of these two roles and many people and many companies often use them interchangeably. They mix the tasks and responsibilities of these two very often. For example there are plenty of job descriptions for "DevOps Cloud Engineer" or "Cloud DevOps Engineer", which would naturally make you think that they are the same role, but then why would you have two names for the same role? And that's exactly what I'm going to discuss and clarify in this video.


🔗💡  What is DevOps and DevOps Engineer Tasks and Responsibilities
                                                                                                     ►  https://youtu.be/0yWAtQ6wYNM
🔗💡  From Zero to DevOps Engineer - Roadmap              ►   https://youtu.be/G_nVMUtaqCk

videoTitle: Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment (CI-CD) with Azure DevOps

videoTitle: Entendendo "Devops" para Iniciantes em Programação (Parte 1) | Série "Começando aos 40"
videoDescription:
Finalmente chegamos no tema final da série! Vamos falar um pouco sobre o tal do "devops".

Esta parte meio que depende dos conceitos que vimos nos últimos episódios então se você é iniciante, e ainda não assistiu os anteriores, recomendo que faça isso.

No episódio de hoje quero dar um pouco do contexto histórico, dos anos 90 até os anos 2000, indo de configuração manual de máquinas, hospedagens compartilhadas, virtualização até os VPS. Vamos entender como uma coisa foi levando pra próxima.

Muita gente confunde muitos termos, virtualização, paravirtualização, jails, containers, hypervisors e não sabe o que é o que, então eu vou distinguir tudo pra vocês finalmente entenderem.


Podcast: https://anchor.fm/dashboard/episode/ebvp1r
Transcript: https://www.akitaonrails.com/2019/04/10/akitando-47-entendendo-devops-para-iniciantes-em-programacao-parte-1-serie-comecando-aos-40

Eu curto assuntos geek, otaku, novas tecnologias e quero trazer um pouco disso para cá.

videoTitle: What is Platform Engineering and how it fits into DevOps and Cloud world
videoDescription:
Platform Engineering - What it is, how it works and how it fits into DevOps and Cloud world
Also how to approach implementing an IDP - internal developer platform.

🔗💚   Become a DevOps Engineer in 6 months       ►   https://bit.ly/3WKUPGf
🔗💙   Become a Kubernetes Administrator              ►   https://bit.ly/3IMJUWI
🔗🧡   Complete GitLab CI/CD course                        ►   https://bit.ly/42itb4B
🔗 💜  DevSecOps Bootcamp                                       ►   https://bit.ly/3OI6y66

▬▬▬▬▬▬ Thank you Pulumi for sponsoring this video 👏  ▬▬▬▬▬▬
►   Learn more about Pulumi's Internal developer platform-in-a-box: https://pulumip.us/IDP-Platform-Engineering
►   Join PulumiUp - a global Infrastructure as Code conference: https://www.pulumi.com/pulumi-up/

In this video we're going to talk about a relatively new hot topic in DevOps and Cloud space, which is “platform engineering”. There is a lot of discussion going on, where some people are asking whether platform engineering replaces DevOps. Many people say it goes hand in hand and is rather an addition to DevOps, but in reality it's a bit more complicated than that. Platform engineering actually changes a lot of established rules we knew about DevOps, SRE and Cloud engineering, it changes the game and introduces some new rules.

So let's clearly define, what platform engineering exactly is, more interestingly, why was there even a need for this new role and how it evolved and of course how it compares to DevOps and Cloud engineering and does it really replace any of these roles?


▬▬▬▬▬▬ T I M E S T A M P S ⏰  ▬▬▬▬▬▬
0:00 - Intro and Overview
0:50 - Why Platform Engineering? Issue in traditional and DevOps teams
08:30 - Standardize usage of tools
09:09 - Non-functional requirements
10:55 - What Platform Engineering is responsible for?
15:47 - How Platform Engineering works? Internal Developer Platform (IDP)
17:53 - How it looks in real-world?
22:33 - Flexibility with Infrastructure as Code
24:30 - How to implement an IDP successfully
30:14 - Platform Engineering vs DevOps
34:53 - Both Skills in TWN education
39:33 - Platform vs Cloud Engineer
41:01 - Wrap Up

videoTags: what is devops in simple english
channelDescription:
GitHub is the AI-powered developer platform to build, scale, and deliver secure software. We make it easier for developers to be developers: to work together, to solve challenging problems, and to create the world’s most important technologies. We foster a collaborative community that can come together—as individuals and in teams—to create the future of software and make a difference in the world.

The GitHub platform is where developers can create, share, and ship the best code possible. Our community is made up of students, hobbyists, consultants, enterprise professionals, partners, and executives, building software in the way that works best for them.

GitHub is much more than code. It is the home of open-source collaboration. It is where new developers get started and where experienced developers expand their knowledge. It is a community where developers come together to solve the unsolvable and test the limits of what software can do.

 #edureka #DevOpsEdureka #DevOps #whatisdevops #DevOpsCertificationTraining #devopstutorialsforbeginners 

-------------------

About These Courses

Edureka’s DevOps online training is designed to help you master key tools of DevOps lifecycle like Docker, Puppet, Jenkins, Nagios, GIT, Ansible, SaltStack, and Chef used by a DevOps Engineer for automating multiple steps in SDLC. During this course, our expert DevOps instructors will help you:
1. Understand the concepts and necessities of DevOps
2. Understand the need for DevOps and the day-to-day real-life problems it resolves
3. Learn installation and configuration of common infrastructure servers like Apache, and Nginx for the Enterprise
4. Learn popular DevOps tools like Jenkins, Puppet, Chef, Ansible, SaltStack, Nagios, and GIT
5. Implement automated system update, installations, and deployments
6. Learn Virtualization Concepts
7. Configuration deployment and packaging, continuous integration using GIT
8. Fine-tune Performance and set-up basic Security for Infrastructure
9. Manage server operations using Code which is popularly known as Infrastructure as a Code
10. Understand the need for and concepts of Monitoring and Logging.

Along with the above-mentioned topics, to help you master the most popular DevOps tools, you will also receive 3 additional self-paced courses including presentations, class recordings, assignments, solutions for the following tools:
1: Ansible - Covers Introduction, Setup & Configuration, Ansible Playbooks, 37 Ansible Modules, Different Roles and Command Line usage.
2: Chef - Covers Introduction, Building the Cook Book, Node Object & Search, Data-bags, Chef environment, Roles, Deploying Nodes in Production and using the Open Source Chef Server.
3: Puppet - Covers Puppet Infrastructure & run-cycle, the Puppet Language, Environment defining Nodes and Modules, Provisioning a Web Server and Executing Modules Against A Puppet Master. 
-------------------

Who should go for this course?

DevOps practitioners are among the highest paid IT professionals today, and the market demand for them is growing rapidly. With the emergence of new job roles around DevOps philosophy, anyone aspiring to get into these new roles can take up this DevOps course. Some of these roles are:

1. DevOps Architect

2. Automation Engineer

3. Software Tester

4. Security Engineer

5. Integration Specialist

6. Release Manager

-------------------

videoTitle: DevOps Vs. SRE: Competing Standards or Friends? (Cloud Next '19)
videoDescription:
Google has been practicing Site Reliability Engineering (SRE) since the early 2000’s but only recently began speaking about it publicly. Some have called SRE “DevOps 2.0,” while others view it as a competing standard. Is SRE the new DevOps? Or is SRE something only large companies can benefit from?

Attendees will learn how SRE and DevOps align, diverge, and disagree.

videoTitle: Roadmap to crack Remote DevOps Jobs in 2025 - How He Earn Euros in India as a DevOps Evangelist

But Remote Jobs come with their own twists and turns. To discuss the harsh reality of remote jobs, we have with us Savinder Puri.

videoTitle: DevOps Interview Questions & Answers! (How to PASS a DevOps Engineer Interview!)
videoDescription:
DevOps Interview Questions & Answers by Richard McMunn of: https://passmyinterview.com/devops-engineer-interview/
#devops #devopsengineer #devopsinterviewquestions
In this interview tips training tutorial, Richard McMunn will cover:

1. A list of DEVOPS interview questions I recommend you prepare for;
2. Example ANSWERS to help you PASS your DevOps Engineer interview;
3. The QUALITIES you MUST demonstrate during your DevOps interview;
4. Further resources to help you PASS your DevOps Engineer interview!

HERE'S A FULL LIST OF DEVOPS ENGINEER INTERVIEW QUESTIONS
Q1. Tell me about yourself and why you want to work in this DevOps role?
Q2. What are the most important skills and qualities needed to work as a DevOps Engineer?
Q3. Why do you want to work for our organization in this DevOps role?
Q4. Tell me about the hardest day you’ve had as a DevOps Engineer?
Q5. What are your strengths and weaknesses?
Q6. You are giving a presentation to a number of non-technical company managers. They have no technical knowledge and they are struggling to understand your presentation. How would you adapt your presentation, so they all understand?
Q7. Where do you see yourself in the future?
Q8. How do you handle stress and pressure at work?
Q9. What does DevOps mean to you and what is its purpose in our organization?
Q10. Tell me how DevOps differs from Agile / SDLC?
Q11. What is an inode on Linux?
Q12. In your opinion, which are the top DevOps tools and what are they used for?
Q13. Tell me how you'd go about optimizing a database?
Q14. What is garbage collection programming?
Q15. Talk me through the steps you would follow when checking physical memory on Linux?
Q16. Explain how you copy a local file to HDFS?
Q17. Describe how you would make a background process run?
Q18. Assuming there are no cookies, how would you make your application work?
Q19. Talk me through the process of what happens when someone accesses a URL via a web browser?
Q20. What is the difference between CI and CD?
Q21. Tell me how you would measure network packet?
Q22. What is a distributed cache in Hadoop?
Q23. There are a large number of requests due to high demand. How would you ensure your database works?
Q24. Why do you want to leave your current job?
Q25. What are your salary expectations in this DevOps Engineer role?
Q26. That’s the end of your DevOps interview, do you have any questions for the panel?

Connect with Richard McMunn on LinkedIn.com:
https://www.linkedin.com/in/richard-mcmunn-coach/

Download Richard's 26 DevOps Engineer Interview Questions and Answers guide in PDF:
https://passmyinterview.com/devops-engineer-interview/

channelDescription: CareerVidz was founded by interview expert Richard McMunn in 2011 and it specialises in teaching job-seekers everything there is to know about careers, tests and interview questions and answers. Thanks to YouTube, Richard McMunn has put together two decades of his own expertise in careers and education whilst working in the emergency services and the armed forces. He has compiled all of this information into easy to view, step-by-step video tutorials that will help you pass your job interview or test. At the CareerVidz channel, you will find Richard McMunn often talking about his own experiences and how they have helped thousands of job-seekers and students to 'get the advantage' over other people by using key tips and strategies guaranteed to bring success. videoTitle: Deploying to on-premises Windows machines with Azure DevOps - Part 1 | DevOps Lab
videoDescription:
In this series, Abel and Zachary Deptawa walk through deploying to on premises Windows servers behind firewalls using Azure DevOps.

In part one, we walk through configuring a Build for a .NET application inside of Azure DevOps. In later episodes, the build will be used with Deployment Groups on Windows servers and we'll set up a Release Pipeline to repeatably and reliably deploy to those Windows servers behind a firewall.

Follow Zachary Deptawa on Twitter: @zdeptawa
Follow Abel Wang on Twitter: @abelsquidhead

Azure DevOps: https://dev.azure.com
Deployment Groups in Azure DevOps: https://aka.ms/dol/DeploymentGroups
Create a Free Azure Account: https://aka.ms/c9-azurefree

#azuredevops #azurepipelines #windowsmachines
channelDescription:
This is the Microsoft channel for videos related to the various DevOps tools, practices and services. Subscribe to learn more about the vast Microsoft technologies such as Azure DevOps, GitHub & GitHub Actions, cloud native technologies, all while delivering greater DevOps capabilities in Azure! 

DevOps is not only a product but a practice, a culture and a mindset. Most importantly, it is for everyone! DevOps allows you to plan, execute and iterate your work in a way that delivers a higher quality product to your customer and increases value to your entire organization. DevOps methodologies enable collaboration and transparency. Here we’ll deliver content on the various technologies that enable DevOps on Azure.

Why AWS is important?

There are various upcoming companies who have leveraged AWS cloud solutions for their growth. AWS was the first company which started to provide cloud solutions on a large scale. DevOps implementation is going through the roof with most of the largest software organizations around the world invested heavily in its implementation. videoTitle: Top 5 DevOps Certifications in 2023 | Highest Paying Certifications | KodeKloud
videoDescription:
Are you looking for the best DevOps certifications in 2023? If so, you've come to the right place! In this video, we're sharing the top 5 DevOps certifications that are likely to be in high demand in 2023.
DevOps certifications are one of the best ways to show hiring managers that you're qualified for a technical position. They're also a great way to set yourself up for more advanced career opportunities.

01:42 - Why Certifications are Important
03:35 - Python Certification
05:30 - Docker
06:15 - Kubernetes

08:57 - Linux
10:16 - Conclusion

Want to view a clear path to becoming a DevOps Engineer? Visit our website - www.kodekloud.com
We have various Learning Paths to help you choose your next step and shape your DevOps Career. 

Check out our learning paths at KodeKloud to get started:

 -Linux: https://bit.ly/LinuxLearningPath
- DevOps Learning Path: https://bit.ly/DevOpsLearningPath-YT
 -Docker: https://bit.ly/DockerLearningPath
 -Kubernetes: https://bit.ly/KubernetesLearningPath
 -Infrastructure as Code(IAC): https://bit.ly/IACLearningPath
 -Programming: https://bit.ly/ProgrammingLearningPath

 
Those new to the Programming and DevOps world often find it challenging to start their journey due to the missing basic prerequisites. For example, issues with setting up a basic lab environment using VirtualBox, problems with networking, or trouble with working with the Linux CLI or text editors like vi editor. Sometimes there are issues with applications - like getting a sample application to work, problems with getting the dependencies to install correctly or trouble with getting a web server to communicate with a database server. Or, at other times, it's working with data formats like JSON or YAML.

So we have identified a gap, and we believe that this is due to missing some of the basic prerequisites, such as knowing the basics of Linux, the basics of tools like VirtualBox, or knowing the basics of the most commonly used applications like Java, Python or NodeJS or web servers like Apache, NGINX etc. As a DevOps or Cloud Engineer, it is crucial to have these basics cleared. And that’s why we are helping you to bridge that gap!

videoTitle: Which One is Right for You? Cloud Engineer vs DevOps Engineer
videoDescription:
DevOps engineer and Cloud engineer have similar skills and responsibilities, but their role is pretty distinct. So in this video, we'll compare and contrast the roles of the DevOps engineer and the Cloud engineer, to help you decide which one is right for you. After watching this video, you'll know which one is the right fit for your needs! 



In this video we will cover the following topics:

00:00 -  Introduction
01:14 - What is a DevOps Engineer?
02:44 - What is a Cloud Engineer?
04:12 - What's the Difference?
04:42 - How are they valued?
05:53 - Which one you should consider?
06:45 - What salary can you expect?
07:40 - Learning Paths

Want to view a clear path to becoming a DevOps Engineer? Visit our website - https://bit.ly/Kodekloud-YT

 -Infrastructure as Code(IAC): https://bit.ly/IACLearningPath
 -Programming: https://bit.ly/ProgrammingLearningPath

 
Those new to the Programming and DevOps world often find it challenging to start their journey due to the missing basic prerequisites. For example, issues with setting up a basic lab environment using VirtualBox, problems with networking, or trouble with working with the Linux CLI or text editors like vi editor. Sometimes there are issues with applications - like getting a sample application to work, problems with getting the dependencies to install correctly or trouble with getting a web server to communicate with a database server. Or, at other times, it's working with data formats like JSON or YAML.

So we have identified a gap, and we believe that this is due to missing some of the basic prerequisites, such as knowing the basics of Linux, the basics of tools like VirtualBox, or knowing the basics of the most commonly used applications like Java, Python or NodeJS or web servers like Apache, NGINX etc. As a DevOps or Cloud Engineer, it is crucial to have these basics cleared. And that’s why we are helping you to bridge that gap!

videoTitle: Deploy docker Image to App Service with Azure Devops ? Azure Container Registry with Build pipeline
videoDescription:
In this video we will see the practical session of creating and pushing the docker image  to Azure Container Registry. 
We will first create the Azure Container Registry in Azure Portal and then we will create Azure App Service for docker.
And then we will configure the image.
Building and Push part to container registry will be done via Azure Devops with using the respective task.
I have used the same code to create docker image, which is hsoted in GitHub and the link of that is available here
https://github.com/vinavintechno/docker-hello-world-flask
You can directly use this code or can use this in your own repository as well.
Push and deploymnet to Azure App service has been done with the helpl of Service connection. I have not created the service connection in this video, but I have a seprate video for the same and here  is the link for the same..
How to create service connection in Azure Devops..
https://youtu.be/pSmKNbN_Y4s
You can also treat this video as "How to create build pipeline for docker deployment".

You wiill notice that in thise video , I have not used the CD, continues deployment pipline, even  I have done that in CI it self. As because here I am not producing any build artifact . But Yes, if we are looking for that, we can also do that. Might be I will  create a new video for that , that how to do the deployment of Docker Image via Continuous deployment.

videoTitle: Will AI replace DevOps Engineer? AI tools in DevOps 2024
videoDescription:
AI for DevOps | Will AI replace DevOps engineers | DevOps AI tools
In this DevOps video we will learning How AI and ML can be used in DevOps tasks like CICD, Monitoring, Logging, Deployments and more.
Along with Popular AI tools in devops and companies using AI with Devops.

Connect with me on LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/nasiullha-chaudhari/ 

AI and DevOps are two fascinating fields in the tech world, and they're coming together in exciting ways. Many companies are exploring how AI can help improve their DevOps practices to make things smoother and more efficient.

With AI, we can automate repetitive tasks, optimize resource usage, and make better decisions.

A common question is whether AI will replace DevOps or the engineers working in this area. Well, AI can certainly enhance DevOps, but it won't replace the people. Instead, it will work alongside skilled DevOps engineers to make things even better.

Timestamps
Intro 0"00
Eminem Featuring 0:50
DevOps Tasks that AI can replace 01:20
Popular AI tools in DevOps 03:25
Companies using AI in DevOps 04:40
How Netflix AI with DevOps 04:48
How Google uses AI in Devops 04:58
How LinkedIn uses AI for DevOps 05:16
Problems when using AI for DevOps 05:47
Outro 07:26

The GitLab Developer Survey, available at https://about.gitlab.com/developer-survey/ 

AI Tools for DevOps:
1. Splunk
2. Harness
3. Amazon CodeGuru
4. PagerDuty
5. Dynatrace
6. Datadog
7. AppDynamics
8. Opsani
9. Puppet
10. Chef

These AI-powered tools, combined with popular DevOps platforms, enable organizations to accelerate their software development and delivery processes while ensuring greater reliability, scalability, and performance. The integration of AI in DevOps brings innovative solutions to complex challenges, allowing teams to focus on creating value for their customers.

1. Netflix: Netflix is well-known for its use of AI and machine learning to optimize content delivery, personalization, and infrastructure management in their DevOps workflows.
2. Google: Google has been a pioneer in AI research and has integrated AI tools and technologies into their DevOps processes to improve system performance and operational efficiency.
3. Facebook: Facebook uses AI and machine learning algorithms to optimize infrastructure, manage user data, and streamline their continuous deployment practices in DevOps.
4. Amazon: Amazon's AWS offers various AI-powered DevOps tools and services, such as Amazon CodeGuru, AWS CodePipeline, and AWS CodeDeploy, to help developers automate tasks and improve software delivery.
5. Microsoft: Microsoft uses AI in their DevOps workflows to optimize Azure services, automate infrastructure management, and enhance developer productivity.
6. Spotify: Spotify uses AI-driven analytics and monitoring tools to gain insights into application performance and user behavior, enabling continuous improvements in their DevOps practices.
7. Twitter: Twitter employs AI and machine learning for infrastructure management, incident detection, and performance optimization in their DevOps pipelines.
8. Uber: Uber utilizes AI to manage large-scale infrastructure, improve data analysis
9. Airbnb: Airbnb leverages AI to optimize their continuous deployment and delivery pipelines
10. IBM: IBM has integrated AI technologies into their DevOps tools and solutions, such as IBM Cloud Pak for Applications, to facilitate intelligent automation and faster software delivery.

Adoption of AI in DevOps is not limited to these companies alone. More and more companies are embracing AI in their DevOps processes. By doing so, they can reduce manual work, spot issues faster, and deliver higher-quality software to their customers.

In conclusion, AI and DevOps make a fantastic team. They bring exciting possibilities for the future of software development, making it more efficient and effective. Embracing AI in DevOps can give your company a competitive edge in the tech world. So, let's welcome this exciting partnership!

channelDescription:
Tanay Pratap, lovingly called Tanay Bhaiya, is an engineer, turned educator, turned entrepreneur.
Tanay started his career in Network Security, then delved into Artificial Intelligence, and finally found his love with web development. He has worked at multi-national companies such as Cisco and Microsoft.
At Microsoft, he worked on Microsoft Outlook and Teams - products with millions of users all over the world.
Tanay Bhaiya had been teaching on the side since 2014. But he finally stepped up in 2020 when the COVID-19 pandemic left students with no job prospects.
Since then, Tanay has guided thousands of students to their first jobs in development through his two startups NeoG Camp and Roc8.
With great power comes great responsibility.
Realizing the impact that he can create on the education system of the country, Tanay resigned from his well-paying job at Microsoft and raised $5M in funding to fix education.
Follow Tanay Bhaiya to witness how he changes education and hiring in India.

videoTitle: What Is DevOps? | How To Implement? | Benefits of Implementing DevOps | Malayalam
videoDescription:
What is DevOps? | How To Implement? | Benefits of Implementing DevOps | Malayalam

Introducing DevOps is becoming a major steps in any new age software development life cycle. This video will give you what is DevOps and how to implement DevOps in each phases of Software Development Cycle such as 

1. Planning phase
2. Coding Phase
3. Build Phase
4. Continuous Testing 
5. Continuous Deployment 
6. Continuous Monitoring 
7. Continuous Integration 

Also discussing why an organization should introduce DevOps approach and the various benefits they could achieve by rolling out ‘DevOps’. The key benefits are 

•Ensure faster deployment.
•Stabilize work environment.
•Significant improvement in product quality.
•Automation in repetitive tasks leaves more room for innovation.
•Promotes agility in your business.
•Continuous delivery of software.
•Fast and reliable problem-solving techniques 

Finally a brief intro about waterfall model and the importance of switching to agile approach in software development and DevOps is an extension to the agile approach.

channelDescription:
Welcome to the official Grafana Labs channel! You’ll find tutorials about the Grafana LGTM Stack (Loki for logs, Grafana for visualizations, Tempo for traces, and Mimir for metrics); demos of the latest features in our fully managed Grafana Cloud platform; highlights from all our major events, and much, much more.

Grafana Labs provides an open and composable monitoring and observability stack built around Grafana, the leading open source technology for dashboards and visualization. Grafana Labs helps manage observability strategies with the LGTM Stack, which can be run fully managed with Grafana Cloud or self-managed with the Grafana Enterprise offerings — both featuring extensive enterprise data source plugins, dashboard management, alerting, reporting, and security.

videoTitle: Taking Advantage of the Azure DevOps Wiki as a Developer | DevOps Lab
videoDescription:
In this episode, Abel sits down with Dipendra Namdeo to talk more about the Azure DevOps Wiki.

As developers, we have special needs when it comes to wiki’s and documentation. Specifically, we often have our documentation sit next to our source code in our repos, allowing us to version our documentation along with our source code. This developer-specific workflow is totally supported by Azure DevOps Wiki. Dipendra walks us through this developer focused workflow on this episode of DevOps Lab.

Resources:
 - Azure DevOps: https://dev.azure.com?WT.mc_id=devopslab-c9-dabrady

videoDescription:
ทำไมแต่ละองค์กรถึงให้นิยามความหมายของ DevOps ไม่เหมือนกัน แม้กระทั่ง JD ของอาชีพ DevOps Engineer แต่ละที่ยังแตกต่างกันอย่างสิ้นเชิง

ถ้า DevOps คือแนวคิด ไม่ใช่ตำแหน่งงานแล้ว จะหยิบจับใครมาเป็น DevOps Engineer ก็ได้จริงหรือ? 🤫

ร่วมฟังความคิดเห็นจาก 2 มุม 2 สายอาชีพ 👨🏻‍💼 ตัวแทนทีม Software Developer โดยคุณปุ๋ย สมเกียรติ ปุ๋ยสูงเนิน - Technical Coach ที่สยามชำนาญกิจ  👨🏻‍💼 และตัวแทนทีม Operation หรือ DevOps Engineer, SRE, Platform Engineer โดยคุณเดียร์ จิรายุส นิ่มแสง - ผู้ก่อตั้ง และ CEO ของ Opsta (Thailand)

รายการ Career Lab รายการที่สำรวจและเจาะลึก insight ต่าง ๆ ของอาชีพที่ in-demand ที่สุดในตอนนี้ เราจำนำพา Expert ตัวท้อปขมานั่งเม้าท์ฉ่ำกับประเด็นสุดร้อนแรงแบบไม่มีกั๊ก และไม่เคยพูดถึงที่ไหนมาก่อน !!

✅ กว่า 70% ของ DevOps Engineer ในปัจจุบันไม่ใช่ DevOps ที่แท้จริง?
✅ DevOps (อาจ) ไม่มีอยู่จริง จริง ๆ แล้วคือ Platform Engineering
✅ องค์กรจะปรับตัว Transform ในการทำ DevOps ที่แท้จริงได้อย่างไร?
✅ โลกของ DevOps การทำงานจริง ใครควรรับผิดชอบอะไร ทั้งในมุมของทีม Software Dev และทีม DevOps Engineer, SRE, หรือ Platform Engineer?
✅ Team Lead หรือ Tech Manager ควรจะแก้ปัญหา ความไม่เข้าใจกันระหว่างทีมพัฒนาในองค์กรอย่างไร?

videoTitle: The future of DevOps and the complexity of Kubernetes
videoDescription:
DevOps Engineer Cherwin Nooitmeer on the complexity of Kubernetes and the future of DevOps.

“The future of DevOps is going to be boring”

What is DevOps?
There are programmers that write software that need to run on computers, we call them servers. And when a programmer writes software, someone needs to put that software on the computers. So people like you and me can access facebook.com and see pictures of cats. Right?

The process from getting the software from a developer to one of the computers that Facebook has, because you can imagine, they have a lot of them. How you do that, that is where DevOps comes in.

So you write software and you have to put it in production. The gap in between, that's where my focus is. And I try to reduce that gap, so it's instant basically.

Why DevOps?
Companies have started to realize, if you have good DevOps processes you can deliver value to the customer faster. You can just outperform all competitors.

What’s the future of DevOps?
The future of DevOps, I hope, from my perspective, is going to be boring. DevOps will develop and become more mature. We will get better tools and better ways of doing things, like testing and doing infrastructure in a way that is reliable and fast. Hopefully, my job will be as a commodity so I can work on other things and add even more value to customers.

What is Kubernetes?
So what we need to do is to make sure we can run software, that we can update it, roll back things, etcetera. These are similar things that every company needs to do.

So Google came and they basically understood and standardized the way of rolling out software and deploying it to users, making sure everything works fine. They basically extracted their learnings into a product. And that product is Kubernetes. People like I use Kubernetes to build platforms so we can enable companies to deliver value to customers faster.

What I do think about Kubernetes is that when people see it, they see it’s awesome and they all try to use it. I think that's a mistake.

Is the hype real?
There’s a lot of hype around Kubernetes. But Kubernetes also adds a lot of complexity. And I think the complexity gets overshadowed by the hype. People think it’s fine and it just works and you can use it.

But what I do think, this complexity that is there is necessary. Because if you are not going to use the complexity of Kubernetes, you are going to create your own system that you need to maintain and develop. Because it's not only software that we use to service users. You also need to write software to service the servers, if that makes any sense. Right?

And if you are going to write it yourself. What happens if you hire a new guy? Now you have to explain to the new guy how your complexity works. So instead of using a complexity that everyone knows, you’re going to create your own complexity. And now you have to teach everybody about your own complexity. And then you need to maintain it.

So this is a trade-off, what are you going to do? I mean, if you have a very simple problem and can get away with having less complexity. Then maybe Kubernetes is not the right thing for you.

videoTitle: How to configure DevOps for Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations and connect with Visual Studio
videoDescription:
The video demonstrates how to configure DevOps for Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations and connect with Visual Studio. Beginning from the creation of a DevOps free cloud service to the creation of the DevOps project and repository folders for the Main branch, the training shows then to Visual Studio and connect to the DevOps project. Then there are various steps to map the local Main and Dev branch folders to the remote repository on the DevOps service. The successful strategy of Main and Dev branches is discussed in the background of sandbox and production instances via LCS and how the strategy is successful. Additionally, a sample D365 VS project is created and demonstrated the check-in, and then how to replace any previous check-in versions from history.

#devops #d365fo #tfvc #visualstudio #development

videoTitle: The Science of DevOps
videoDescription:
Unveiling the Power of DevOps
Welcome to my latest video where I unravel the science behind DevOps and explore the transformative DORA Metrics. Discover the insights from the groundbreaking book "Accelerate," authored by Dr. Nicole Forsgren, Jez Humble, and Gene Kim. This essential book, published in 2018, delves into the 24 key capabilities that drive improvements in software delivery performance. From Continuous Delivery to Cultural Capabilities, we break down the crucial aspects that elevate your DevOps game.
Learn how DORA Metrics - Lead Time for Changes, Deployment Frequency, Time to Restore Service, and Change Failure Rate - scientifically measure software delivery performance. 
Gain insights from the State of DevOps reports, comparing elite performers to low performers, and see how metrics translate into real-world benefits like faster time to market, enhanced quality, and top-tier employee satisfaction.
Witness the evolution of DevOps from 2018 to the present, as more companies embrace elite-level practices. Access all State of DevOps reports and a self-assessment tool for your organization's software delivery performance.

videoTitle: What is Containerization in Devops explained
videoDescription:
Defined by the placement of a software component and its environment, dependencies, and configuration into an isolated unit called a container, containerization makes it possible to deploy an application consistently on any computing environment, whether on-premises or cloud-based.

videoDescription:
Jira Azure DevOps integration would especially be useful for keeping the backend and frontend developers synced. So, you can easily sync Azure DevOps data with Jira issues automatically and in real time. 

In this step-by-step tutorial, we’re going to show you how to integrate Azure DevOps with Jira in a simple most flexible way using Exalate. 

Exalate is a cross-company integration solution that enables you to integrate different issue trackers and work management systems like Jira, ServiceNow, Azure DevOps, Zendesk, GitHub, and many more.

videoTitle: Understand DevOps in Under 8 Minutes | #devops | Matrix Bricks
videoDescription:
DevOps is one of the most talked-about practices in tech today, but many still aren’t clear on what it actually means. In this video, Mehul Brahmbhatt, Founder and CEO of Matrix Bricks, explains DevOps in simple, practical terms for anyone new to the concept.
Whether you're a developer, product manager, or just curious about how modern software teams work, this video covers the fundamentals in under 8 minutes.

💡 Why This Video Is a Must-Watch:
⦿ Clearly explains what DevOps is and why it exists
⦿ Helps you understand how development and operations work better together
⦿ Breaks down the major challenges DevOps solves in software delivery
⦿ Covers essential principles like automation, CI/CD, and continuous feedback
⦿ Offers insight into how real teams use DevOps to improve speed and quality
 
🛠️ What You’ll Walk Away With:
⦿ A beginner-friendly understanding of DevOps without technical jargon
⦿ A grasp of how CI/CD pipelines help teams deploy faster and more reliably
⦿ Knowledge of the four key pillars that drive successful DevOps practices
⦿ A clearer view of how DevOps improves collaboration across teams
⦿ The confidence to start learning or applying DevOps in your own work

This is a quick overview designed to give you a clear understanding of the topic—no prior experience required.
📌 If you're building digital products or working in tech, understanding DevOps is essential to keeping up with how software is built and delivered today.
👍 If you found this helpful, consider subscribing for more tech insights.
💬 Questions or thoughts about DevOps? Leave them in the comments.
 
📤 Share this with someone starting their DevOps journey.
For more on how DevOps fits into digital transformation, visit Matrix Bricks.

videoTitle: لو لسه متخرج .. إزاي تدخل عالم DevOps خطوة بخطوة؟ مع أحمد فاضل
videoDescription:
في الحلقة دي بنناقش كل التفاصيل المهمة عن عالم DevOps. هنتكلم عن اللي كان بيحصل في تطوير البرمجيات قبل ظهور الـ DevOps وإزاي غير المشهد تمامًا. كمان هنوضح الفرق بين DevOps وSRE، وليه بعض الشركات بتفضل تستخدم واحدة عن التانية. لو بتسأل عن فرص الشغل في المجال ده سواء في مصر أو بره، هتعرف حجم الفرص وأهميتها ومتوسط الرواتب اللي ممكن تحققها. الحلقة كمان بتجاوب على سؤال مهم: إيه اللي محتاج تعمله كخريج جديد عشان تبدأ في المجال؟ وهتديك نصايح عملية لكل اللي محتاج تكون مجهزه قبل ما تروح الإنترفيو. متفوتش الفرصة دي لو عايز تبدأ مشوارك في DevOps بخطوات ثابتة وواضحة.

لينك أكونت ضيفنا أحمد فاضل:

videoTitle: No coding to DevOps Career: Market Trends, Salary Insights & DevOps Job Opportunities in Germany.
videoDescription:
Are you considering a career in DevOps or exploring new opportunities in the field? In this video, we dive deep into the current DevOps job market, explore salary expectations, and discuss how learning German can significantly boost your chances of landing a job in Germany.

What You’ll Learn:

Free and Paid Learning Resources: Discover where you can start learning DevOps, from free YouTube tutorials to paid courses.
Job Market Trends: Understand the current job market for DevOps professionals in India and Germany.
Salary Expectations: Get insights on expected salaries for fresh graduates and experienced professionals, including potential earnings in startups, medium-sized companies, and large corporations.
Application Tips: Learn how to prepare a compelling resume, the importance of cover letters, and strategies for applying to job portals and company career sites.
Motivation Matters: Find out why showing genuine interest and motivation can make a difference in your job application.
Key Takeaways:

DevOps offers numerous career opportunities, even without a formal background in the field.
Learning German can give you a significant edge in the German job market.
Salary expectations vary based on experience and company size, with high earning potential in large firms and consulting companies.
Subscribe for more insights into career development, industry trends, and tips for success. Share your questions and thoughts in the comments below!

videoTitle: What is the difference between DevOps and Platform Engineering?
videoDescription:
Confused about the disparities between DevOps and Platform Engineering? Wondering if Platform Engineering is just a rebranding of DevOps? In this video, we delve into the nuances and distinctions between these two critical disciplines. Discover how DevOps began and it's impact on end-to-end application deployment, and the emmergence of Platform Engineering and it's focus on building self-service toolchains and workflows for efficient software engineering in the cloud-native era. Learn why understanding these differences is essential for successful digital transformations.

videoTitle: DevOps Meetup Zurich 2024: Platform Engineering
videoDescription:
This video captures my presentation delivered at the DevOps Meetup in Zürich on January 25, 2024, where I delve into the prevalent challenges faced by traditional DevOps methodologies, characterized by isolated teams and fragmented value streams that impede efficiency. It explores DevOps as a holistic culture, mindset, and suite of technical practices designed to foster continuous value delivery, prioritize products over projects, and focus on customer-centric development. Additionally, I introduce Platform Engineering as a strategic evolution of DevOps aimed at mitigating the technical and operational complexities encountered when scaling DevOps in larger enterprises. Highlighting a collaborative project with LGT and Zühlke, I present the Platform Plane case study, demonstrating how an internal developer platform can streamline and standardize DevOps processes across various teams, thereby reducing cognitive load and enhancing productivity. This presentation goes beyond theoretical discussion, offering a hands-on demonstration of the Platform Plane and its functionalities, including Kubernetes as a service, API gateway, and Service Mesh, among others. It illustrates the vital role of Platform Engineering in enabling product teams to adopt DevOps more efficiently and effectively, leading to an optimized development lifecycle.

videoTitle: Secure  secrets with Azure KeyVault using DevOps Variable Groups
videoDescription:
Secure application secrets with Azure KeyVault using DevOps Variable Groups.


Arguments:
-DBNAME "$(DBNAME)" -DBUSERNAME "$(DBUserName)" -PASWORD "$(Password)"

Inline Script :
Param(
[string]$DNBAME,
[string]$DBUSERNAME ,
[string]$PASWORD
)

Write-Host "##vso[task.setvariable variable=DNBANE]$DBNAME"
Write-Host "##vso[task.setvariable variable=DBUSERNAME]$DBUSERNAME"
Write-Host "##vso[task.setvariable variable=PASWORD]$PASWORD"

videoTitle: DevOps for Beginners: How Netflix & Amazon Deploy Without Downtime | #devops
videoDescription:
Every second, millions use apps and websites—yet most don’t realise the seamless experience is powered by one powerful approach: DevOps.
But how do companies like Netflix, Amazon, and Facebook push updates daily without breaking things? In this video, Mehul Brahmbhatt, CEO & Founder of Matrix Bricks, breaks it all down in simple, practical terms—especially for beginners and aspiring tech professionals.
 
💡 Why This Video Is a Must-Watch If You're in Tech (or Planning to Be):
⦿ Understand what DevOps really is—and why it’s more than just a buzzword
⦿ Learn how DevOps speeds up development, reduces bugs, and prevents downtime
⦿ Discover the key DevOps practices: CI/CD, IaC, automated testing, and more
⦿ See real-world examples of how tech giants use DevOps at scale
⦿ Find out how even small teams can adopt DevOps for massive impact
 
🛠️ What You’ll Walk Away With:
⦾ A clear, beginner-friendly explanation of DevOps and how it works
⦾ Insights into Continuous Integration and Continuous Deployment (CI/CD)
⦾ How Infrastructure as Code simplifies and accelerates IT operations
⦾ Why monitoring and feedback loops are critical for performance and security
⦾ The confidence to start applying DevOps practices in your own team or career
🚫 Stop treating DevOps like a complicated tech mystery.
✅ Start learning how it can transform your software development process.

videoTitle: How to Sync Jira with Azure DevOps
videoDescription:
📌✨🎥 Streamline your software development workflows with Unito's 2-way Azure DevOps - Jira Integration! 🚀

Are you a project manager looking to enhance collaboration between Azure DevOps and Jira for your dev teams? Look no further! 🤝 With Unito's 2-way sync, you can seamlessly connect work items in Azure DevOps with issues in Jira, ensuring consistent and up-to-date information in real-time! ⏰

✨ Book a live demo with our team
unito.io/demo/?utm_source=youtube&utm_medium=video&utm_campaign=jira_ado_demo

Unito supports essential fields in Azure DevOps and Jira, including:

💼 Title/Summary: The title or summary of the issue or work item provides a brief description of what the task or issue entails.

📝 Description: The detailed description of the issue or work item, including any additional information or context needed for team members to understand the task.

👤 Assignee: The person responsible for completing the task or addressing the issue. Keeping the assignee field in sync ensures that the correct team member is aware of their responsibilities.

🔢 Status: The current status of the issue or work item, such as "To Do," "In Progress," or "Done." Syncing the status field helps everyone stay updated on the progress of tasks.

🔝 Priority: The priority level of the issue or work item, which helps determine its importance and urgency. Syncing the priority field ensures that team members are aligned on task prioritization.

🏷️ Labels/Tags: Categorizing issues or work items with labels or tags helps with organization and filtering. Keeping these fields in sync ensures consistent labeling across both platforms.

💬 Comments/Updates: Any comments or updates made on an issue or work item should be synced to provide real-time collaboration and visibility for everyone involved.

⏰ Due Date: If there is a specific deadline or due date associated with the task or issue, syncing this field helps the team stay on track and meet deadlines.

📎 Attachments: Any files or attachments related to the issue or work item should be synced to ensure easy access and collaboration.

📌 Work Item Type/Issue Type: The type of work item or issue, such as bug, feature, or task. Syncing this field provides clarity and consistency in categorizing different types of work.

Try Unito's Azure DevOps - Jira integration for free today and eliminate manual updates and double-entry of data! ⚡️✨ Create a Jira issue and watch as it automatically generates a corresponding Azure DevOps task using Unito's powerful 2-way sync. Any changes made in either system will be automatically updated in the synchronized platform, keeping everyone on the same page. 💪

Customize your sync by selecting specific fields and custom fields, tailoring it to your software development team's unique needs. Unito empowers project managers to achieve greater efficiency and accuracy in their workflows, leading to enhanced collaboration and better results. 💡

channelDescription:
Unito's 2-way integrations connect SaaS applications and tools through a simple self-serve, point-and-click interface. So your manual changes in one app automatically update the other in real-time. That's the power of 2-way sync. 

Use it to sync tasks, tickets, issues, spreadsheet rows, calendar events, contacts, and more for smoother collaboration, greater efficiency, and productivity.

Unito supports integrations for: Trello, Asana, Jira, Google Sheets, Google Calendar, Notion, ClickUp, Airtable, GitHub, Wrike, Microsoft Excel, HubSpot, monday.com, Azure DevOps, Smartsheet, Zendesk, Teamwork, Salesforce and other popular work management tools.

videoTitle: How to set up an Azure DevOps Unity3D local build agent with build pipeline, installer and upload.

videoTitle: DevOps in an Embedded World
videoDescription:
Dive into the transformative world of DevOps in the embedded industry with me. This video brings to life my presentation from the DevOps Meetup in Munich on November 15, 2023, offering a deep dive into the evolution of software development methodologies and the pivotal role of DevOps in driving innovation.

Embark on a journey from the constrained waterfall methodologies to the agile landscape, where a product-centric approach addresses real customer needs. Discover the challenges that plague the industry, from legacy systems and budget constraints to the "wall of confusion" that disrupts effective collaboration. More than a strategy to overcome these hurdles, DevOps emerges as a culture of collaboration, inclusivity, and continuous improvement.

Experience the power of DevOps through the success stories of industry giants like Tesla and SpaceX, illustrating how Agile and DevOps principles can elevate a company's market position. Gain insights into the essential capabilities for enhancing software delivery performance, inspired by the seminal book "Accelerate."

Learn about the critical role of Platform Engineering and the Digital Factory model in embedding DevOps practices within product teams. This innovative approach not only simplifies the development process but also ensures consistency and fosters an environment ripe for continuous value delivery and breakthrough innovation.

Join me in this exploration of DevOps' potential to revolutionize the embedded industry, paving the way for future advancements. Your journey towards understanding and implementing DevOps principles starts here.

videoTitle: Boosting Productivity: Mastering SSH Integration in Azure DevOps And Git Repos
videoDescription:
How to clone git repository via SSH Keys | How to clone git repository via SSH Authentication

Command: ssh-keygen -t rsa -b 4096

0:00 Introduction
0:15 How to generate SSH keys (private and public)
2:10 How to add SSH public key into Azure DevOps Organization

In this era of cloud computing and automation, mastering SSH authentication is essential for any developer. SSH or Secure Shell is a cryptographic network protocol designed for secure data communication. It is often used in passwordless authentication scenarios, improving the productivity and security of developers.

Working with Azure DevOps, an all-inclusive suite of development tools provided by Microsoft, can be significantly enhanced by using SSH. Azure DevOps comprises various services including Azure Repos, which is a set of version control tools that help developers manage their code. Azure Repos is versatile in that it supports both Git and Team Foundation Version Control.

One of the ways to interact with Azure Repos is using Git, a popular open-source version control system. When using Git with Azure Repos, developers have the flexibility to work with their codebase using various Git clients, including the popular VS Code. However, to establish a secure connection between these clients and Azure Repos, proper authentication is crucial.

This is where SSH comes in. Using SSH, you can authenticate to Azure DevOps, and particularly, Azure Git Repositories, without entering your username and password every time. This not only saves time but also minimizes the risk of your credentials being exposed.

This guide aims to help developers configure SSH for Azure DevOps, understand how to clone Azure Git Repos using SSH, and embrace passwordless and public key authentication methods for seamless and secure operations. Whether you're an IT professional, software engineer, or someone interested in learning about DevOps, this information will equip you with valuable insights into SSH integration and usage.

This video is about:-
SSH Authentication
Azure DevOps Tutorials
Azure Repos
Azure Git Repositories 
VS Code with Azure DevOps
Git Authentication
Clone Azure Git Repo with SSH
How to use SSH authentication with Azure DevOps 
Ssh passwordless authentication
Ssh with public key authentication 
Using SSH to authenticate Git in Azure DevOps
Clone git Repository using SSH in Azure DevOps

videoTitle: Steps to Enable Parallel Jobs In Azure DevOps (AZ-400)
videoDescription:
All you will get information in this Video: https://youtu.be/DBQLl360Mz0

Purpose of Parallel Jobs: The video explains how to enable parallel jobs in Azure DevOps, which is necessary for running CI/CD pipelines.

Creating a Project: Start by creating a project within your Azure DevOps organization, noting your organization URL.

Access Billing Settings: Navigate to the organization settings, select "Billing," and locate the option for parallel jobs.

Parallel Jobs Availability: Initially, new organizations have zero parallel jobs available, preventing pipeline execution until jobs are enabled.

Requesting Parallel Jobs: Users must request parallel jobs through a specific URL provided by Microsoft, as they no longer provide them by default due to past misuse.

Misuse Prevention: Microsoft stopped offering free parallel jobs by default because users exploited them for unauthorized activities like Bitcoin mining.

Request Process: Fill out the form with your name, the same email ID used for Azure DevOps, and your organization URL. Request only private parallel jobs unless you have a valid reason for public jobs.

Approval Timeframe: It typically takes 24 to 48 hours for Microsoft to approve parallel job requests.

Verification: After approval, you can verify the availability of parallel jobs in the Azure DevOps portal under the "Parallel Jobs" section in the billing settings.

Billing Setup for Additional Jobs: For additional parallel jobs, users need an active Azure subscription (e.g., Pay-As-You-Go), and setup billing, linking it to the Azure subscription. This will allow for purchasing more parallel jobs if needed.

videoTitle: What Is DevOps?  - Explained With Real World Examples!
videoDescription:
Start your DevOps Career (Beginners - Advanced) - https://bit.ly/DevOpsLearningPath-YT

DevOps is a buzzword. It’s huge right now in the tech community, and it’s definitely becoming more central to how teams build software.
If you’re starting with DevOps, this video will help you understand the basics and give you a good head-start on your journey. You will also learn about the different stages in DevOps, what tools are needed at each stage, and how potential problems should be handled.

Start your DevOps Career (Beginners - Advanced) - https://bit.ly/DevOpsLearningPath-YT

In this video we will cover the following topics:

00:00 -  Introduction
00:27 - Problems before DevOps
01:33 - Two Stages of DevOps
02:12 - Real World Scenario 1
03:28 - Real World Scenario 2
04:12 - Automation
05:06 - Benefits of DevOps
06:10 - Summary
07:22 - Conclusion
 
Those new to the Programming and DevOps world often find it challenging to start their journey due to the missing basic prerequisites. For example, issues with setting up a basic lab environment using VirtualBox, problems with networking, or trouble with working with the Linux CLI or text editors like vi editor. Sometimes there are issues with applications - like getting a sample application to work, problems with getting the dependencies to install correctly or trouble with getting a web server to communicate with a database server. Or, at other times, it's working with data formats like JSON or YAML.

So we have identified a gap, and we believe that this is due to missing some of the basic prerequisites, such as knowing the basics of Linux, the basics of tools like VirtualBox, or knowing the basics of the most commonly used applications like Java, Python or NodeJS or web servers like Apache, NGINX etc. As a DevOps or Cloud Engineer, it is crucial to have these basics cleared. And that’s why we are helping you to bridge that gap!

Want to view a clear path to becoming a DevOps Engineer? Visit our website kodekloud.com!
We have various Learning Paths to help you choose your next step and shape your DevOps Career.

channelName: 情シス向けIT・DX最新トレンドを紹介 マジセミ
videoTitle: DevOps とは？～エンジニアじゃなくてもわかる ITトレンド解説 ～
videoDescription:
DevOps とは？
～エンジニアじゃなくてもわかる ITトレンド解説 ～

★フルバージョンはこちらから無料で視聴できます！
https://majisemi.com/e/c/dynatrace-20210305

はい、マジセミ寺田です！皆さんこんにちは！今日は DevOps について解説をしていきます。
エンジニアじゃなくてもわかるように簡単に解説していきますのでよろしくお願いします！
私はマジセミという、IT関連のWebセミナーを年600回程度運営しています。
他のテーマの動画もたくさんUPしてますので是非そちらもご覧ください！
今日のテーマは DevOps ですね、DevOps ってなに？って思われるかもしれないんですけども"Dev"と"Ops"をくっつけた造語なんです。
"Dev"っていうのは"デブロップメント"システムの開発です。"Ops"は"オペレーション"、システムの運用です。
昔は開発と運用が分かれていて、組織も分かれていて、場合によっては会社も分かれてるケースもよくありました。
なんで分かれていたか？というと性格が違うからなんです。
開発はどんどん良いものを作っていきたいと考えているのですが、新しい機能を動かす時や何らかのイベントがある時はトラブルが起きやすいんですね。
逆にいうと何にも変更がないまま運用している分にはそんなにトラブルは起きません。
なので新しい機能を入れるとか改善するとかそういう事をやりたくないというのが運用チームの立場でなんです。
こういった、今までの組織の在り方を理解した上で、現代ではDX（デジタルトランスフォーメーション）が非常に注目されていますが、その中で重要なのはスピードです。
今まではシステムを開発して機能の改善をして、それが使えるようになるのは１年後だとか短くても３ヶ月後という感覚でした。
しかしその感覚だと追いつかなくなってしまいます。
来週、もっと早ければ明日にでも使って欲しい、とスピードが求められています。
そんな中、今までのように開発のチームと運用のチームが分かれていると、全然スピードが追いつかないという事で、もうその工程を１つにしてしまって、開発したらすぐに運用出来るようにする、といった具合に、そもそもの組織のあり方を含めて根本的に作業の進め方を変えていくというのが" DevOps "の考え方や方法論です。
また、今回のセミナー（https://majisemi.com/e/c/dynatrace-20210305）では2021年の米国の最新動向についても紹介しています。
これは" DevOps "だけじゃなくて他にも"AIOps"や”コンテナ”などの最新動向についても解説していますので、" DevOps "や米国のIT最新動向に関心のある方は見ていただければと思います！

DevOps methodologies enable collaboration and transparency. Here we’ll deliver content on the various technologies that enable DevOps on Azure.

videoTitle: هل الـ DevOps engineers مطلوبين في الشركات؟
videoDescription: في الحلقة دي بنناقش كل التفاصيل المهمة عن عالم DevOps. هنتكلم عن اللي كان بيحصل في تطوير البرمجيات قبل ظهور الـ DevOps وإزاي غير المشهد تمامًا. كمان هنوضح الفرق بين DevOps وSRE، وليه بعض الشركات بتفضل تستخدم واحدة عن التانية. لو بتسأل عن فرص الشغل في المجال ده سواء في مصر أو بره، هتعرف حجم الفرص وأهميتها ومتوسط الرواتب اللي ممكن تحققها. الحلقة كمان بتجاوب على سؤال مهم: إيه اللي محتاج تعمله كخريج جديد عشان تبدأ في المجال؟ وهتديك نصايح عملية لكل اللي محتاج تكون مجهزه قبل ما تروح الإنترفيو. متفوتش الفرصة دي لو عايز تبدأ مشوارك في DevOps بخطوات ثابتة وواضحة.

videoTitle: Terraform and Cloudflare with GitHub Actions | DevOps Automation
videoDescription:
I will be demonstrating how to use #terraform with Terraform Cloud to manage #cloudflare  domains and automate the process with GitHub Actions. #githubactions 

Cloudflare is one of the most popular content delivery networks used today and managing its domains can be a hassle. But with Terraform, we can easily automate the process and make our lives much easier.

In this tutorial, I will walk you through the steps of setting up Terraform with Terraform Cloud and GitHub Actions, and show you how to use it to manage your Cloudflare domains. You will learn how to create a Terraform configuration file, set up Terraform Cloud and create a workspace, and then use a GitHub Actions pipeline to automate the deployment process.

Whether you are a seasoned developer or just starting out, this tutorial is for you. It is designed to be easy to follow and will give you the knowledge you need to automate your Cloudflare domain management with Terraform.

So, sit back, relax, and get ready to learn how to use Terraform with Terraform Cloud and GitHub Actions to manage your Cloudflare domains. Don't forget to like and subscribe for more great tutorials!


Here you can find the tutorials files on my github: 
https://github.com/marcogreiveldinger/videos/tree/main/terraform-github-actions-cloudflare

Cloudflare Provider documentation:
https://registry.terraform.io/providers/cloudflare/cloudflare/latest/docs

Terraform Cloud:
https://www.terraform.io/

Terraform tutorial with Github Actions:
https://github.com/marketplace/actions/hashicorp-setup-terraform

videoTitle: Working in DevOps | Cyber Work Podcast
videoDescription:
Steve Pereira of Visible Value Stream Consulting discusses DevOps, SecOps, DevSecOps and his own lifelong love of streamlining projects. You’ll hear how his dad’s job with Bell Telephone facilitated his early explorations, the intersections of DevOps and Agile, the ever-important security component of it all and why following your interests and not the big money payouts might not work in the short run, but ultimately will get you where you want to go in the end.

– Start learning cybersecurity for free: https://www.infosecinstitute.com/free

About Infosec

By the end of this tutorial, you'll understand how to define cron jobs in your Azure DevOps pipelines, ensuring your workflows are efficient and automated. Cron jobs are essential for running scheduled tasks, such as backups, updates, and custom scripts, at specified intervals.

videoTitle: Unit Testing for SQL Server Database in DevOps process
videoDescription:
⚡ In this part of the video, we’ll look into how specifically dbForge Unit Test takes part in the development process. Execution of unit tests is one of the most important stages in the database DevOps process because it guarantees that all changes committed by developers to the database project will be verified and and that all functionality will continue working properly after the database is deployed.

Before including unit tests to the DevOps testing process, they first need to be created. You can do it with the help of dbForge Unit Test. This tool also enables you to execute these tests during the CI process.

ℹ️  Including dbForge Unit Test into the DevOps process. The following conditions are necessary for unit test execution:
📍  the tSQLt framework is installed in the database you need to test;
📍 unit tests are present in this database;
You can install the tSQLt framework with the help of the dbForge Unit Test tool for the database on which unit tests will be executed.

dbForge Unit Test provides a convenient interface for creating new tests and modifying existing ones.

Check more useful information: 
🔥 How dbForge Unit Test is involved in the DevOps process here:
https://www.devart.com/dbforge/sql/database-devops/unit-testing.html

videoTitle: How to Migrate TFS to Azure DevOps
videoDescription:
OpsHub Migrator for Microsoft Azure DevOps (OM4ADO) is an enterprise-grade Azure DevOps migration tool developed in partnership with Microsoft. Designed for seamless, no disruption migration, OM4ADO effortlessly transfers work items, test entities, projects and more between all Azure DevOps combinations with no downtime.

OM4ADO allows you to move data across organizations and collections, and customize the migration process to meet your needs. The delta sync feature ensures a smooth cutover by allowing for incremental updates and synchronization between source and target systems. This eliminates the need for source system downtime, as you can continue using it while the target system is validated. 

Watch how OM4ADO can move projects between the source and the target in this TFS to Azure DevOps (VSTS) migration in five simple steps.

videoTitle: What is CI/CD? DevOps and CI/CD Explained
videoDescription:
🎯 Get your FREE AWS Cloud Projects Guide and gain real hands-on experience with AWS. 
👉 https://digitalcloud.training/free-aws-cloud-projects/
Start building the skills that get you hired!

_______________________

In this video tutorial, we break down one of the most important concepts every AWS Developer should understand: CI/CD - Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery/Deployment.

You’ll discover:

• What Continuous Integration (CI) means and how developers use it to frequently merge code into a shared repository like GitHub.

• How automation tools like AWS CodeBuild test and compile your code after each change, helping catch integration issues early.

• The difference between Continuous Delivery and Continuous Deployment, including when manual approvals are used and when code is pushed directly to production.

• How AWS CodePipeline connects everything together, creating a streamlined, event-driven process from source code to build, test, and deploy.

We walk you through each stage using visuals and real-world examples to show how these AWS services work together to speed up development while maintaining quality.

This lesson is essential preparation for hands-on labs and real-world use of AWS CodePipeline, CodeBuild, and CodeDeploy.

videoTitle: GitKraken Client v8.5 Release: Workspaces for Azure DevOps
videoDescription:
Download the free legendary GitKraken Git client, now with support for Azure DevOps Workspaces: https://bit.ly/3FKrTWb

GitKraken Workspaces are now available for repositories hosted on Azure DevOps. This will allow Azure DevOps users to group all repositories in a project within a Workspace and share them with teams – making provisioning repositories easy and straightforward.

New Workspaces may now be shared with specific teams, making it easier to share repositories with the people who work on them. And, the Pull Requests section in Workspaces can now be filtered by repositories, including multiple repos at once. 

A new GitKraken command has been added to the GitKraken CLI for interactive rebase. Use `gk rebase -i` or `gk rebase -- interactive` to open the interactive rebase view for the 2 refs provided.

videoTitle: Top DevOps Certifications In 2023 | With English Subtitles
videoDescription:
Top DevOps Certifications In 2023 | Malayalam

A DevOps certification could enhance your resume, boost your salary potential, validate your expertise in development cycles, and set you up for more advanced career opportunities.
DevOps positions are consistently ranked among the highest paying in the technical field. 

In this Video, we'll go focus on some of the most  popular DevOps certifications to consider and walk through some of the potential benefits of getting certified.

The Top DevOps Certifications are

1. AWS Certified DevOps Engineer - Professional - for DevOps engineers who work with cloud technology, especially in an Amazon Web Services (AWS) environment.

2. Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA) - for IT professionals who manage Kubernetes instances, including Kubernetes administrators and cloud administrators

3. Docker Certified Associate (DCA) - for DevOps engineers, software engineers, and others who work with Docker

4. Puppet Certified Professional - for DevOps engineers and IT professionals

5. Microsoft Certified: DevOps Engineer Expert - for DevOps engineers and this is recommended for Expert in Azure administration or development and familiarity with both. Either Microsoft Certified: Azure Administrator Associate or Microsoft Certified: Azure Developer Associate Certification required as a prerequisite.

videoTitle: 📈🎓Mastering the DevOps Engineer Road Map🌟🔧 | #thillaithetechie
videoDescription:
✅ Foundational Knowledge: Understand Linux, scripting (Python/Bash), and networking basics.

✅ Version Control: Master Git for source code management and collaboration.

✅ CI/CD Pipelines: Learn Jenkins, Travis CI, or CircleCI to automate testing and deployments.

✅ Configuration Management: Gain expertise in Ansible, Puppet, or Chef for infrastructure as code.

✅ Containers and Orchestration: Dive into Docker and Kubernetes for efficient application deployment.

✅ Cloud Platforms: Get hands-on experience with AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud for scalable solutions.

✅ Monitoring and Logging: Implement tools like Prometheus, Grafana, and ELK stack for system monitoring.

videoTitle: Azure DevOps GitHub Integration with 2-way Sync and Real-Time Updates
videoDescription:
Here's how to quickly set up a secure, seamless 2-way integration that keeps your development teams in sync between Azure DevOps and GitHub. 

00:00 - Use Case
00:30 - Sync Demo
01:30 - Connect to Unito
02:00 - Flow Direction
02:25 - Set Rules and Triggers
02:51 - Linking Fields and Configurations

✨Try it free today:✨
🔗 https://bit.ly/3tAQXYN

Unito supports essential fields in Azure DevOps and GitHub, including:

💼 Title: The title or summary of the issue or work item provides a brief description of what the task or issue entails.

📝 Description: The detailed description of the issue or work item, including any additional information or context needed for team members to understand the task.

👤 Assignee: The person responsible for completing the task or addressing the issue. Keeping the assignee field in sync ensures that the correct team member is aware of their responsibilities.

🔢 Status: The current status of the issue or work item, such as "To Do," "In Progress," or "Done." Syncing the status field helps everyone stay updated on the progress of tasks.

🔝 Priority: The priority level of the issue or work item, which helps determine its importance and urgency. Syncing the priority field ensures that team members are aligned on task prioritization.

📌 Work Item Type/Issue Type: The type of work item or issue, such as bug, feature, or task. Syncing this field provides clarity and consistency in categorizing different types of work.

🏷️ Labels/Tags: Categorizing issues or work items with labels or tags helps with organization and filtering. Keeping these fields in sync ensures consistent labeling across both platforms.

💬 Comments/Updates: Any comments or updates made on an issue or work item should be synced to provide real-time collaboration and visibility for everyone involved.

⏰ Due Date: If there is a specific deadline or due date associated with the task or issue, syncing this field helps the team stay on track and meet deadlines.

📎 Attachments: Any files or attachments related to the issue or work item should be synced to ensure easy access and collaboration.

------------

videoTitle: How dbForge SQL Complete is Involved in the Database DevOps Process
videoDescription:
⚡ In this part of the video, we’ll look into how specifically dbForge SQL Complete takes part in the database development process. The dbForge SQL Complete is a powerful IntelliSense-style SQL completion, code refactoring, code formatting tool for SQL Server. SQL Complete is available as an add-in for Visual Studio and SQL Server Management Studio.

ℹ️ In the automated CI process, SQL Complete serves as a means to format update or database creation scripts before they get into a NuGet package.
When database development is in the hot phase, developers often tend to forget about formatting a script before sending the UPDATE scripts to source control (Git) or use different formatting tools with inconsistent settings.

As a result, the script formatting in NuGet looks like a mess that has nothing in common with the corporate code formatting standards.
dbForge SQL Complete is a robust tool which can help developers write and format code while saving time on these processes.
